item.description:
Porgy and Bess (abridged)

FREE

Undergraduate vocal students present George Gershwin's Porgy and Bess (abridged) as this year's Undergraduate Black Box Opera performance on Thursday, December 1, at 7:30 PM, in Millard Auditorium, University of Hartford, 200 Bloomfield Avenue, West Hartford.  America's great folk opera, using the platform of the impoverished community of Catfish Row in the 1920s, tells a timeless story of the triumph of the human spirit over tragedy.  Come and experience this amazing work as Hartt's taleneted undergraduate singers explore this unique treasure of American opera and break down racial stereotypes.  Stage director is Ron Luchsinger and musical director and conductor is Doris Lang Kosloff.   Admission is free.
item.how_to_find_us: Meet in entry way to the auditorium, will wear the bw scarf, with piano keys.
